He also voiced concerns over Shubman Gill's T20I form and India's bowling issues.

title: Lululemon CEO Calvin McDonald to step down in January as sales continue to drop
description: Lululemon CEO Calvin McDonald is stepping down January 31 amid a challenging sales year, with the board seeking a successor.  The athletic wear brand reported a 2% net revenue decline in the Americas and a 13% profit fall in its third quarter, facing increased competition and market shifts. Shares rose over 10% following the announcement.

description: The feature would allow shoppers to place a "unified" order combining items from Amazon's online store and its physical outlets, according to the report

title: IndiGo crisis: DGCA sacks 4 flight operations inspectors for oversight; airline asked to hire more pilots
description: The DGCA has dismissed four inspectors overseeing IndiGo after the airline failed to hire enough pilots for upcoming flight duty time limits, leading to disruptions and a temporary rollback of rules. Despite DGCA warnings, IndiGo denies shortages. Sources cite deep mistrust between pilots and management, worsened by pay changes, policies, and attempts to restrict pilots from taking jobs abroad.

description: US lawmakers of Indian origin have voiced strong concerns regarding Trump administration policies, including a $100,000 H1B visa fee and 50% tariffs on India. These measures, they argue, are detrimental to American businesses and are damaging the crucial people-to-people ties between the US and India, impacting economic and geopolitical interests.

title: Should the early education business be regulated?
description: The Hindu hosted a webinar, ‘Should the early education business be regulated?’, on December 6, at 5:00 p.m. The panellists were Abhisek Chowdhury, Advocate; Sethuraman K, Founder, BeWise; and Ujjwal K. Chowdhury, Educator & Author. The webinar was moderated by Ravina Warkad, Senior Sub-Editor, Education vertical, The Hindu.

title: ‘Do what you love’: Steve Jobs’ 2005 mantra still inspires - why money ‘never mattered’ to him
description: Steve Jobs' 2005 Stanford commencement speech continues to inspire professionals with its core message: find and do work you love. Jobs emphasized that passion is the key to satisfaction and great achievement, even recounting how being pushed out of Apple led to a creative resurgence. He asserted that love for his work, not money, was his driving force.

This gathering follows a separate dinner attended by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, fueling discussions about power dynamics within the ruling party.

title: 'Pained by loss': PM Modi announces Rs 2 lakh for Andhra bus accident victims
description: A tragic bus accident in Andhra Pradesh's Alluri Sitharama Raju district claimed nine lives and injured twenty. Prime Minister Narendra Modi offered condolences to the affected families. An ex gratia of Rs 2 lakh was announced for the next of kin of the deceased and Rs 50,000 for the injured from the Prime Minister's National Relief Fund.

title: Rough November for Elon Musk's Tesla as US sales sink to nearly 4-year low
description: Tesla's November US sales hit a nearly four-year low, with cheaper "Standard" models failing to boost demand despite the end of EV tax credits. Analysts suggest these new variants are cannibalizing premium sales and that Tesla urgently needs new vehicle models to compete with upcoming cheaper options from rivals.

title: Lure of better life turns tribal youth into drug mules
description: Hundreds of tribal youth from the Agency areas of Alluri Sitharama Raju district languish in jail after getting caught with ganja and charged under the stringent NDPS Act, 1985. Many had been lured into the smuggling network by the drug mafia, dangling the promises of a quick buck or an expensive gadget. Harish Gilai finds out how extreme poverty, lack of employment opportunities and ignorance of consequences led them into taking a decision that sealed their futures

title: ASR district bus accident: Most of the deceased were from Chittoor
description: The ASR district police have already reported nine deaths and 22 injuries, officials confirmed that a significant number of the victims were residents of Chittoor district

description: Bengaluru is among the few cities in India surrounded by two protected areas. But calls for animal rescue have increased as the expanding city is pushing out urban wildlife from their natural habitats

title: In Pictures: Former Union Minister Shivraj Patil (1935-2025)
description: The Congress leader was Union Home Minister from 2004 to 2008 and the 10th Speaker of the Lok Sabha from 1991 to 1996. He was the Governor of Punjab and also served as Administrator of the Union Territory of Chandigarh from 2010 to 2015.

Kant, gaming jargon — and outrage: South Korea's 'impossible' English test goes viral; exam chief quits
description: South Korea's exam chief resigned after the English section of the national university entrance exam was criticized for being too difficult. The test's absolute grading system saw its lowest top-grade achievement since 2018, with many students and educators deeming the questions overly specialized and convoluted. This unusual resignation highlights the intense pressure surrounding the Suneung exam.

'Saw some good signs': India coach backs out-of-form Shubman Gill, Suryakumar Yadav
description: India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate expresses unwavering confidence in Shubman Gill and Suryakumar Yadav, despite their recent batting struggles. He believes the duo's class and past performances, particularly Gill's IPL record, assure their return to form ahead of the T20 World Cup. Ten Doeschate emphasised the team's absolute faith in their ability to deliver when it matters most.

title: Rajinikanth turns 75: PM Modi, Stalin extend birthday wishes to ‘Thalaiva’
description: Superstar Rajinikanth is celebrating his 75th birthday, receiving warm wishes from Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin. Modi lauded his five-decade cinematic legacy, while Stalin praised his charisma and contributions. Rajinikanth, affectionately known as 'Thalaiva', continues to be an influential figure in Indian cinema, recently honored with a Lifetime Achievement Award.

description: Disney and other creative industry giants had been suing AI firms like OpenAI, Perplexity and Anthropic, accusing them of illegally using their content

title: ‘I stand with every Hindu’: Bengal LoP ‘honours’ men who attacked food vendors; trio gets bail
description: West Bengal's Leader of the Opposition, Suvendu Adhikari, felicitated three men arrested for assaulting chicken patty vendors at a religious event, shortly after their bail. Adhikari stated his primary duty is to protect his dharma and Hindu brothers and sisters, asserting his legal team facilitated their release.

title: Rupee tumbles to fresh life-time low! Reaches to 90.52 against US dollar
description: The Indian rupee hit a record low of 90.52 against the US dollar on Friday, extending its sharp decline this year. This weakness is attributed to a widening trade deficit, strong corporate dollar demand, and US tariffs. The Reserve Bank of India has intervened to stabilize the currency, which has lost over 5% this year.

IBPS, SBI, RRBs: FinMin announces major recruitment reforms; what candidates must know
description: The Finance Ministry has introduced major reforms to streamline recruitment examinations and result declarations for SBI, NBs and RRBs through IBPS. Officer-level results will now be announced first, followed by clerical-level results, with a standardised sequence across banks. The changes aim to enhance transparency, reduce attrition, and allow candidates to make informed choices. The move addresses operational challenges arising from workforce migration and ensures more predictable, stable recruitment in public sector banks, as quoted by the PTI.

title: Piracy hits a brief pause, but web of leaks still unbroken
description: The recent arrests of movie-piracy masterminds have given the Telugu film industry a small ray of hope. Incidents of films being taped inside theatres have dipped, offering brief relief. But with piracy domains still thriving and fresh leak trails emerging from theatres in other States, the battle against organised networks remains long and complex, writes Sangeetha Devi Dundoo

title: Madras High Court places District Judge Pa.U. Chemmal under suspension
description: He had come to adverse notice of the Madras High Court for alleged misuse of official authority during his tenure as Principal District-cum-Sessions Judge at Kancheepuram

title: South Africa create history; become most successful team against India in T20Is
description: India suffered a significant 51-run T20I defeat to South Africa, leveling the series and marking their most losses against any opponent. South African pacers achieved a rare feat, taking all ten wickets. India's inability to chase over 210 and the large margin of loss highlight persistent challenges ahead of the T20 World Cup.

description: President Trump issued a grave warning about the Russia-Ukraine war, fearing it could escalate into a third world war. He expressed deep frustration with stalled peace talks, urging an immediate halt to fighting. European leaders are now stepping in to shape negotiations, while battlefield pressures mount. Trump insists swift action is crucial to prevent a wider global conflict.

title: ‘Surrender or bid final Lal Salaam’: CM Mohan Yadav claims Naxalism wiped out in MP
description: Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav highlights the virtual elimination of Naxalism as his foremost achievement, stating that those involved have either been eliminated or surrendered. He also outlined plans to double farmers' income by reducing production costs and increasing irrigated land, and aims to make the 2028 Simhasth Kumbh a global spiritual event showcasing Indian culture and knowledge.

title: 'Operation Langda': 5th criminal shot in the leg in a month in Bihar
description: Bihar Police are now shooting criminals in the leg during encounters to prevent escapes, a tactic unofficially dubbed 'Operation Langda'. This strategy has led to the arrest of several wanted criminals, including Rakesh Kumar, who was shot in the leg and apprehended in Patna after allegedly firing at police.

title: Former Union home minister Shivraj Patil passes away at 90; PM Modi condoles loss
description: Veteran Congress leader Shivraj Patil, 90, has died at his Latur home after a brief illness. A seven-time MP from Latur, he served as Lok Sabha Speaker (1991–1996) and Union home minister (2004–2008), resigning after the 26/11 attacks. Patil also held multiple ministerial portfolios and was Governor of Punjab (2010–2015). He is survived by his son, daughter-in-law, and two granddaughters.

The company's heavy reliance on a massive OpenAI deal and its debt-fueled expansion have raised investor concerns about its financial stability and future growth prospects.

title: California man kept in refrigerator for days after 33 drinks on Royal Caribbean ship
description: A wrongful death lawsuit against Royal Caribbean alleges a California man died after a violent restraint by ship security following severe intoxication. His body was reportedly kept in a refrigerator for the remainder of a three-day cruise. The autopsy ruled his death a homicide due to mechanical asphyxiation associated with restraint.

title: Fighting toxic air: World Bank clears $600m in funds; boost for UP, Haryana initiatives
description: The World Bank has approved $599.66 million in financing for two major clean air programs in Uttar Pradesh and Haryana. These initiatives aim to improve air quality, reduce health impacts, and strengthen both states as attractive business destinations. The programs will invest in clean cooking, electric mobility, and cleaner industrial practices.

title: Paige Shiver’s net worth: 55% salary hike and link to Sherrone Moore scandal fuel speculation
description: University of Michigan football is in turmoil as executive assistant Paige Shiver faces intense public scrutiny. Her name is linked to former coach Sherrone Moore's firing and police detainment due to alleged inappropriate relationship rumors. Shiver's recent significant salary increase and social media silence have fueled speculation amid the ongoing investigation.

title: Taylor Swift enjoys a calm Manhattan dinner with Este Haim as Travis Kelce support sparks new talk among fans
description: Taylor Swift was spotted enjoying a private dinner with musician Este Haim in Manhattan, showcasing a stylish and understated look. This outing follows a period of public appearances, including supporting Travis Kelce at a Kansas City Chiefs game, with fans speculating about upcoming birthday plans and future events with Kelce.
